Package camzup.core

Class Rng

java.lang.Object
java.util.Random
camzup.core.Rng
All Implemented Interfaces:
IUtils, Serializable, RandomGenerator
public class Rng extends Random implements IUtils
A convenience for working in the Processing IDE: extends Random so an additional import does not need to be added. Its name is truncated to avoid collisions.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

    • Rng

      public Rng()
      The default constructor. Sets the seed to the system's current time in milliseconds.

  • Method Details

    • nextInt

      public int nextInt(int bound)
      Returns a pseudo-random, uniformly distributed integer value between 0 (inclusive) and the specified value (exclusive), drawn from this random number generator's sequence. Overrides parent random's functionality to clamp the bound to a positive non-zero lower bound rather than throwing an exception.
      Specified by:
      nextInt in interface RandomGenerator
      Overrides:
      nextInt in class Random
      Parameters:
      bound - the upper bound
      Returns:
      the pseudo-random integer
      See Also:
      • Random.nextInt(int)

    • segment

      public float[] segment(int count)
      Finds an array of random numbers that sum to 1.0 . Due to floating point precision, the sum of the numbers may be approximate.
      Parameters:
      count - the number of elements
      Returns:
      the array

    • segment

      public float[] segment(int count, float sum)
      Finds an array of random numbers that sum to a value. Due to floating point precision, the sum of the numbers may be approximate.

      The function first calculates a series of segment end points on a number line from 0.0 to 1.0 . The result array contains the difference between an end point and its preceding neighbor multiplied by the sum.
      Parameters:
      count - the number of elements
      sum - the sum
      Returns:
      the array

    • setSeed

      public void setSeed(long seed)
      Sets the seed for this random number generator and calls next float. For sequences of similar seeds (e.g., 100, 101, 102), the initial random value fetched will be similar. See "First random number after setSeed in Java always similar".
      Overrides:
      setSeed in class Random
      Parameters:
      seed - the seed
